articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as India play Pakistan in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: Hosts India bowl first against Pakistan in front of 132,000 fans

articles.description: Watch BBC One live on BBC iPlayer.
articles.title: Watch: Football Focus. VideoWatch: Football Focus

articles.description: Ireland chase history as New Zealand look to avoid more misery at the hands of Andy Farrell's side in Saturday's unmissable World Cup quarter-final in Paris.
articles.title: 'High stakes for familiar foes in unmissable quarter-final'

articles.description: Pakistan's Abdullah Shafique trapped lbw on 20 by India's Mohammed Siraj at the Cricket World Cup in India.
articles.title: India's Siraj makes breakthrough with Shafique wicket

articles.description: England manager Gareth Southgate says "it defies logic" after some England supporters booed Jordan Henderson on Thursday.
articles.title: Fans booing Henderson 'defies logic' - Southgate

articles.description: Wales' World Cup odyssey takes Warren Gatland's side to France's oldest city as a festival of rugby descends on Marseille.
articles.title: Wales aim for superhero showing in Marseille

articles.description: Lexi Thompson falls just short of making the cut on her PGA Tour debut despite carding a two-under 69 in the second round of the Shriners Children's Open.
articles.title: Thompson narrowly misses cut on PGA Tour debut

articles.description: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson suffers a fractured thumb in Friday's World Cup win against Bangladesh, but could return before the end of the tournament.
articles.title: NZ skipper Williamson suffers thumb fracture

articles.description: Alastair Cook's retirement is not just the end of a prolific career, it could be the end of openers of his style, says Stephan Shemilt.
articles.title: 'Batted, Chef - Cook retires as last of his kind'

articles.description: After making a goalscoring return to the England squad, has Ollie Watkins jumped to the front of the queue to be Harry Kane's main understudy?
articles.title: 'It's been a long time coming' - can Watkins be Kane’s understudy?
